head.supplied: Botanic Gardens, Melbourne ¶ 22. October 1854. ¶ Sir ¶ ¶ I do myself the honor to acknowledge your communication from the 20 instant, ¶ and beg humbly to express my gratitude for his Excellency's li...

div.p: J54/11753, unit 203, VPRS 1189 inward registered correspondence, VA 856 Colonial Secretary's Office, Public Record Office, Victoria.
The letter was forwarded to Lieut. Governor Hotham for his perusal and he returned it read to the Colonial Secretary's Office. Botanic Gardens, Melbourne

I do myself the honor to acknowledge your communication from the 20 instant,
J. Moore to M, 20 October 1854. and beg humbly to express my gratitude for his Excellency's liberality in providing the means for my next excursion to the Snowy Mountains

Having received his Excellency's sanction for this journey, my preparations will be completed at the end of this month, and I shall be ready to execute then any special commands, which his Excellency may be pleased to entrust to me.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: I have the honor to be

div.p: your most obedient and humblest servant
